Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel (Good), Unique Stay (Very Bad)”
Reviews.Author: brendoindubai
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel looking for a unique stay on our Madrid stopover. The check in, location and rooms where all good. The stay only turned bad when around 1am we heard the neighbours come home and then start talking. They followed this up with another hour of "intermate time", then finally at 3am they continued talking and laughing. None of this is a problem to me as they can do whatever they want in thier room, the fact that it kept us awake and we heard everysingle detail was not good. Ensure you to not get Room 109. Things turned very bad in the morning when we went to check out; 1, breakfast doesn't start till 9:30am! 2, the receptionist started dry-reaching during the check out process and then before they got to swipe my card, ran out from behind the desk and ran into the little ajoining cafe where they vomitted all over the floor and continued to vomit in the kitchen there. Once he returned to swap my card my partner joined me in the lobby and we left the hotel as he came back around to the cafe to clean up his mess. In one word the last couple of hours of our stay can be described as a "JOKE". Think again before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cnbacchus
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments/suites at this hotel and I couldn't have more positive words about it. The entire stay was positive and our favourite stay on our 3 week trip. Location: This hotel is conveniently located and close to good nightlife, the metro (for easy transportation), minutes from Gran Via, and it's so lively at night. Some would say it's loud but I never found it obnoxious because if I'm in Madrid, I'm there to have a good time. Besides, once you closed those shutters, there was no sound/no light and it was phenomenal. Suite: The interior decorations are gorgeous and so cute. The kitchen is perfect to use and comes with all the utensils already needed. The bathroom was very nice. The beds were so comfortable. For the time we spent in our apartment, it was perfect for what we needed. Staff: The staff was incredible. Beatriz, Antonio, all of them were so helpful with our questions and helping us with anything we needed. If we called for something, we would have it in a moment's notice. If we needed directions, never failed to help. The amazing staff made this hotel even better than it was. Even offered us great advice about wifi. :) I think the only downfall would be when we were on the balcony something was leaking from above (a/c?) but besides that, I loved this hotel. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and I would recommend it to everyone. Love, love, love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Funky Boutique Hotel in a Central yet Quite Location”
Reviews.Author: uelmes
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel close to many indie shops/bars and about 5 mins walk from Gran Via. Though the rooms are a little on the small side, the hotel makes up for this with it's friendly staff and charming interior. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good situation”
Reviews.Author: miboylan
Reviews.Content: It's the position in Madrid that makes this hotel really worthwhile. We stayed in one of the apartments and it was fine, clean, you had all you needed and reasonably priced. Service was quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Negenduust
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and me stayed there 4 nights. Everything looked very promising on the website. Images had clearly been taken with a wide angle camera, but although every space was much smaller than it appeared on photo, we had nothing to say about the look and feel of the place. Until we arrived in our room where a horrible sewer stench was coming out of the bathroom. We asked for anther room, but the hotel was fully booked. Luckily, i've taken 3 years of spanish classes, because nobody at the reception spoke a word of English (or french, or dutch or german). Only the manager spoke English, but he was never available. We would've tried finding another place, but good luck with that in high season. We had booked this room 4 months in advance. Bottom line, nobody cared to help us with this problem, proactively. They didn't ask us if things were better the next day, didn't report the problem to the new staff, didn't bother to try and fix the problem of which they clearly had knowledge (as I have read in other reviews),... When leaving we asked for the proper discount. They offered us 3%. Can you believe it? Laughing in your face, that's what we call it! Conclusion, apart from its looks, there's NOTHING worth going to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Aba"pu"”
Reviews.Author: CinFLIGHT
Reviews.Content: Can't imagine how none of the other reviewers didn't notice the horrible sewer stench coming out of the bathroom. It was so vial you had to keep a window cracked in order to tolerate it. There is NO THING fine about this hotel and real resent how badly its photos represent it or better yet lack there of. If you've never been to Madrid, do your self a favor and pass this one up you'll have plenty of time to check out the aroma of sewers while trekking through the city.

Reviews.Title: “A Divine Space in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SWJamms
Reviews.Content: We couldn´t have enjoyed this hotel at a better time. The low season in cities like madrid certainly has its perks. This hotel is superbly located and very close to the gtrea museums in the city. The design very in keeping with the feel of the city, funky, eclectic and artisitc. Our junior suite was simply enchanting, an uplifting and fresh combination of colours and fabrics. As a designer by profession, the combinations they showcased was pleasure to both the eye and my touch. Breakfast was a little minimal but it by no means defines the other strengths of Hotel Abalu. In such a city locale, one would be hard-pressed to find such intimacy anywhere else packagedin such a stylish fashion. It lifted our spirits to retire each day in the cheery atmosphere of this gem of a small hotel. The staff were both helpful and charming at all times. Simply put, Madrid would not have been the same without our memorable time here.

Reviews.Title: “Central apartment”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraHodl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Abalu is not only a hotel but also offers apartments in the center. We have found here a large apartment with three bedrooms, a living room, bathroom and kitchen. The disadvantage is that you have to go to the hotel first to check in or out while the apartments are somewhere else. We have walked throughout the whole neighborhood, carrying our luggage. Inside it looked great. It was a beautiful old building, but a very modern interieur. The metro was very close, so we could easily go everywhere. I slept on top of a bunk bed. That was horrible. That bed really need to be replaced. Earplugs are needed here, because the street is very noisy. All in all it was a central and affordable accommodation. Not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique - Cozy, cute”
Reviews.Author: RDimi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel two years ago. The area of the hotel was very nice. Hip and very trendy with plenty of places to go for food or drinks. The reception and cafe, where we had the breakfast was very stylish and the breakfast very good. The room was cozy, small however with taste. There are some improvements that must be done but if this happens then it will be one eof the best hotels. The price was high however.

Reviews.Title: “very good experience as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mark r
Reviews.Content: First off I want to thank the Abalu Hotel for their great customer service. When I arrived at 10am and my check-in time wasn't until 3pm they offered to lock and hold my belongings until my room was ready. Within minutes they upgraded my room and allowed me to check in at 11am without paying any additional costs. The rooms were very clean and whenever I requested anything from conceirge they arrived in less than 5 minutes. The service was impecable and went above and beyond my expectations. The location was perfect and minutes away from every attraction. I absolutely love love love this hotel. Thank you!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique design with Great value / location”
Reviews.Author: NaxLondon
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at this hotel. Rooms were very unique designed - boutique hotel design at normal hotel prices. Location was also very good - away from main tourist drag but in an interesting central neighbourhood

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Park Slope, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the middle of town”
Reviews.Author: Courtney W
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is situated on a bustling little block surrounded by fun restaurants, vintage clothing shops, and local bars. The room was hip and quaint but we did not spend much time in it. It's very close to the Mercado de San Miguel food market where you could almost eat every meal.

Reviews.Title: “Love for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorynyc
Reviews.Content: Became a fan of this hotel by Facebook Actually i found exactly what we expected nice staff, larde besa and gorgeous deco To me The best in town

Reviews.Title: “Avoid or be seriously disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: This must have been the worst and most disappointing hotel experience I've ever had (and I've visited over two dozen countries in 3 continents). The location is noisy and dirty, the fittings cheap, the decoration pretentious, and the receptionist rude and unhelpful. I had booked an Apartasuite Satellite, which was meant to include all kinds of luxuries, including a jacuzzi, but when I arrived to pick up the key I was told that my room did not have a jacuzzi after all. The hotel staff had the audacity to tell me that there had been a glitch in the booking system. I was offered a crappy room as a replacement (with 4 bunk beds even though I was spending a romantic night with my girlfriend) so in the end we cancelled the reservation and booked a room in another hotel. Do NOT waste your time and money in this place. Look elsewhere to avoid disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful design, nice location!”
Reviews.Author: Polsterzipf
Reviews.Content: booking was easy, check-in as well, room very small, but the design was great, very smart, with nice colour accents, certainly an inspiration among the ordinary hotel rooms. The quarter is very hip and alternative, nice pubs and bars and shops from young designers around, though in the hotel it is very quiet and you reach the center by walking in a few minutes. Will certainly come back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Giulia N
Reviews.Content: I travelled together with my daughter and we simply thought it was great. It is right in downtown, very close to the underground. All the personnel was very kind and helpful- The room we stayed in it was small but it had everything, and it felt very cozy- I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff perfect - Rooms perfect”
Reviews.Author: pschubert
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for a business trip in early June 2011, Small Hotel, I would even say a nice design boutique hotel in the center of Madrid. The room they gave me was just perfect, large bed, great bathroom, all just perfect. I would return anytime back in Madrid. A must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly but tired hot hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globaltraveller4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a tired room where the air con hardly worked. The staff were very helpful but we wouldn't stay again or recommend it. There was also no wi fi connection in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, less then one star accommodations”
Reviews.Author: clanceyvision
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from spending a week here and the facilities at this place may have been some of the worst for the money that I have experienced anywhere in the world. Not sure where to start. The jacuzzi in our room took three days any and having to ask five times to have it repaired. Once it was repaired we could not get hot water, actually during the week we only had real hot water three days. Dilapidated shower curtain, light fixtures hanging out of the ceiling, this place may haver been trendy at one time, now it's only trashy. As a matter of fact if you looked out the one window in our room all you could see was trash. I have photos if anyone would like proof.

Reviews.Title: “DONT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: Laurendies
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, despite being down a questionable side street, the lobby was so trendy and cute I thought we'd lucked out. FALSE. Our first room was miniature (ok fine it is Europe), there were dark curly hairs on the white comforter (yes really), and OUR SHOWER DIDN'T DRAIN. After wandering europe all day + residual jet lag- all we wanted was to shower. NOT OK. It was pretty late, and the 'handy man was no longer on site'- so I demanded a new room, which they did give us, and luckily the shower worked. Phew. Unfortunately this hotel in general is just a giant rip off at €114 EUROS/night- we left and went to the best western for $115 DOLLARS with a room twice as big and bathroom maybe 4 times as big as the abalu. The abalu seems to pride itself on it's 'chic boutique' experience. But on closer look everything is pretty shoddily made and no quality to be found. We sucked it up for two nights (they would only let us out of our third nights stay free of charge), but our last night in Madrid at the best western was cleaner, roomier, better (SAFE!) location, AND CHEAPER! Learned my lesson. Chain hotels it is.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair treatment”
Reviews.Author: diamondbed
Reviews.Content: "The place looks like a boutique designer hotel with prices to match; however on arrival it is apparent that the place has been decorated on the cheap" I agree on this previous comment, I should further point out the unfair , messed up and non- professional management. Our flight was cancelled last minute, no problem, according to the no-show policy we lost the first night but we rang up to make sure they would keep our 2 rooms for the day after as per the reservation. So the day 2 at 12 pm we checkedin and been said our rooms werent ready yet for cleanup till 3! How come that, since I paid they should be mine, or did they sell twice!!?? They reacted and found others, but one was a dowdgrade respect to the standard I booked. Last but not least , at first we were bounced at breakfast because mistakenly it appeared it was not included ( it was in their very confirmation mail!) Any dealer should keep his promise, if not there's no repeated buy.

Reviews.Title: “for us heaven in Madrid!!!”
Reviews.Author: sergeiduchov
Reviews.Content: we found this place after being in a terrible hotel nearby. As being recommended by guides I agree that good value, very nice soft beds, soundproof walls and windows, nice swimming pool and breakfast, very decent location, cleaninless and staff. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, overrated, pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Ptitjose
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite for the 30th birthday of my gf + the romantic package (champagne + chocolate fondue with strawberries). In the end, even though I had booked everything way in advance and all the email to prove the booking, the ppl at the reception couldn't find my reservation. Then the bathroom got flooded after a simple shower. The romantic package was incomplete: only a few strawberries, and no champagne as the receptionist thought they already gave it to use (they just don't keep track of anything). Then they forgot I paid for a late check-out... just pathetic. I planned to spend a relaxing and romantic weekend with my gf and instead I spent my time arguing with the receptionists. The breakfast was a very cheap buffet of avg quality. For all these disappointments I could only get a 5% refund... not enough. IT WAS A RIP-OFF! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “nice spa system, good recommendation for madrid”
Reviews.Author: livingabrouad
Reviews.Content: I loved the distress design and the cleaning of the place, this guys they really make you feel like being at home. Also does size matters? I do think so as I have been assigned into the largest business suite I had ever had. Also the restaurant has some good dishes to try late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotels has potential bot maintenance is bad...”
Reviews.Author: NoamA
Reviews.Content: After stain 2 days in the hotel with my son ihave mix feelings about this hotel. On one hand the location is good close to a metro station and not far from the grand via street in downtown Madrid , staff is nice and friendly but on the other hand rooms need a serious maintenance job. It seems that when the hotels was opened rooms were nice and a lot of thought was invested in small details , but today one can see that simple maintenance hasn't been done. The room we stayed in was a bit small but there are other rooms which are larger. Take into consideration that the Shower and bathroom are inside the room with only a curtain as separation. It is not a 3 stars hotel I would say it's a 2 stars hotel

Reviews.Title: “A motel in a nice frame”
Reviews.Author: bangLecce
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very good: in a lively area, a short walk from the Gran Via, Plaza Espana and the Chueca area. I encountered two major problems at Hotel Abalu (room 118): - In spite of what was promised on the website, there was NO internet service at all in the room during my weeklong stay. The staff (most of which kind and courteous) was completely unable to explain or solve the problem. The official wifi internet rate in the room is 10 euros (seriously?) a day, which is ridiculous enough to make you understand how silly this hotel's policy is. In spite of the pathetic price, I needed wifi for work reasons and was therefore willing to pay, but there was NO signal in my room all the time and no compensation gesture was made by the staff for this unexpected inconvenience. The only wifi area was the reception area but I cannot work for hours sitting next to guests checking in and out all the time. Horrible experience. -Cleanliness is an issue at Abalu hotel: the room was full of questionable white stains (on the walls, on the couch, on the armchair). Reception informed. Nothing happened. Besides a thick layer of dust covered the whole living area. Bathroom amenities were never replaced, so after two days we started using our own soap and products. A minor issue: tv and radio in the jacuzzi did not work (what a surprise..) Abalu Hotel is just an example of how hotel websites can be deceiving: you choose the hotel expecting a luxury service and you find yourself in a motel with a nice frame.

Reviews.Title: “Will never visit again”
Reviews.Author: lienepien
Reviews.Content: On my way from south america to holland I decided to treat myself to 3 days Madrid as I had a stopover anyway. Having seen the pictures I thought Abalu would be a nice treat. Unfortunately..... never trust pictures! Travelling solo meant apparently for this hotel to put me in a broomcloset. Really the smallest room I have ever been in, there was not even room for my suitcase...and they call that a hotel??? There was no warm welcome, no explanation on how things in the hotel worked. The airconditioning was leaking and when I asked for it to be repaired I got a: put a bucket under it....... Also the walls were so thin so when my neighbours got home at 2 a.m. and decided to take a shower I woke up just to hear every word from their conversation...This hotel looks so nice but really: don't be fooled by the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “An awful experience ! Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: CapeTownTraveller67
Reviews.Content: Do NOT be fooled by the photographs. Only one word is necessary to describe the condition on the hotel and the rooms - GRUBBY. Furthermore the area while appearing relatively central to those not familiar with Madrid was downright seedy, and actually quite far from the more visited attractions. To make matters with the inclusive breakfast was awful - the cheeses were completely dried out and still not replaced 3 days later when we finally decided to move. Furthermore the so called 'business centre' was a completely dead, clapped out 1990's desktop with an old mini-tv used as a screen.Making matters worse the reception staff didn't even know that it wasn't working (and probably hadn't for months or even years) I'm not sure how this hotel has a rating of 4 on trip advisor but in my opinion it is impossible that this is based on bona fida traveller reviews.

Reviews.Title: “a touch of heaven in the earth”
Reviews.Author: kostankiriakus
Reviews.Content: I loved all aspects of this hotel. We stayed in a petite room, but was surprised that it was more spacious than what I expected. Also great Location! Housekeepers made our bed perfectly on a daily basis. Amazing bathrooms!!!!! I will not be staying anywhere else in madrid in future trips.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: giulialoni
Reviews.Content: very relaxing atmo, nice beds and pillows, perfect spot for a city break, room vary in size and rate depending on your budget obviously.. Liked the city, hotel is located in one of the most modern and vibrant parts of madrid (but you know madrid is not as fashion as barcelona is...) But we found the hotel we were expecting, modern, clean, extra services and very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: charlottejlamb
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend went to Madrid for the weekend and stayed at Hotel Abalu. Unfortuantely despite having booked a twin room which was confirmed in the booking confirmation email and by reception when I called a few days prior to our arrival to check that the booking was confirmed and that we had a twin room, when we arrived we were told that they had made a mistake and that there was no twin room for us. We therefore were told we had to share a double room for the first night, but they would move us to a twin room for the second night our stay. The next day we spoke to reception and they said in fact that they wouldn't be able to give us a twin room as the hotel was fully booked! So the reception staff who had told us they would move us to a twin room for the second night was simply lying! The staff were very unhelpful and offered us no solution or compensation for not providing us with what we asked for. This was a shame as it meant that we had a bad first impression of madrid and had to spend time aruging with the hotel rather than getting out and seeing the city. The rooms are ok, but not as good as they look in the photos, and the ensuite bathrooms are rather odd (toilet is in a tiny cupboard) and the shower was on a raise platform in the middle of the room! I think that it was an attempt to be cool, but really they missed the mark! The reception staff told us they had upgraded us to a room which was two grades above standard - if that was the case I dread to think what the standard rooms are like! Although the hotel is in a good location I would not recommend it to anyone else as the service was so poor and unhelpful (and at times they were simply lying to us!). We did not get what we booked and they seemed not to care at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good introduction to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Snaz
Reviews.Content: Location - Yes, it's centrally located to the Grand Via, however this a a fair way from other attractions. The street/alley that the hotel is on is very grungy, with 1/2 the shops & bars closed and with graffiti'd shutters down. Hotel - Trying very hard to be chic designer but doesn't pull it off. Rooms are truly tiny, airconditioning was not working (for the whole hotel) and the staff seemed not to care. As other reviews stated, it's decorated cheaply and seems to be falling apart. However, the bed was excellent, one of the best. Pity it was too hot and noisy to sleep. Staff - Were nice enough and tried to help when approached, but generally seemed more interested in what they were doing than the guests. Maybe they are trying for chic attitude?

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Tripovertherainbow
Reviews.Content: We had booked for 5 nights, only stayed for 1 night and, thankfully, we easily found a decent hotel to go (at the same price). The rooms are tiny, no wardrobes available, the bathroom door would not close and you would feel that the bathroom is in the same area as the bed, the door would not lock from inside, the window was overlooking in the dark internal of a building, the room was rundown (wall-papers torn-out at the edges, the bathroom furniture worn-out, etc., etc.). You all the time had the feeling that it is very dirty. You have to go to the building next door for an elevator. Service nothing spectacular. We complaint and left, and charged us for one extra night, for cancelling. Very expensive for what it was, but wouldn't stay there, not even for Euro 10 per night. Steer Clear.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible- don't be seduced by the website!”
Reviews.Author: K_Lingwood
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at the hotel after spending 2 nights on my sister's sofabed. Next time I will stick to the sofa. The place looks like a boutique designer hotel with prices to match; however on arrival it is apparent that the place has been decorated on the cheap. The heating, ventilation & hot water services are extremely deficient. We had no hot water on arrival; and didn't sleep a wink due to the extreme heat coming from the central heating system. We lay awake with the window wide open all night, to no avail. It was minus 2 degrees outside. The bathroom door was falling apart and didn't close, the bed was uncomfortable and the tiled corridor outside allowed us to hear everymovement outside. The window gave way to a tiny internal courtyard from which hardly any daylight came through and you could see straight into adjacent bedrooms. The staff were ok if you tried to chat to them, but otherwise appeared sullen and unfriendly. The place is well overpriced for what it is - I have slept in better youth hostels for £10 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, but for a major city hotel, a great value”
Reviews.Author: LTann
Reviews.Content: The service was fine - nothing spectacular. It would be better if the people working there seemed like they actually liked working there, but then their attitude might have been better if we weren't staying on Christmas eve and Christmas day. The room was very funky. The shower was in the bedroom and the toilet in a little tiny closet. However, everything was architecturally interesting and creative and we had everything we needed. One recommendation I would make to the hotel is to paint the back stairs and elevator area. You lose the whole ambiance of the hotel once you step through that door.

Reviews.Title: “A very charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Atum
Reviews.Content: Very charming Hotel! The decoration is very beautifull and cool, without Ikea stuff! The recepctionist who work with the Hotel-Decorater is very nice and trendy! The location it is perfect! One of my favourit Hotel in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the difference”
Reviews.Author: JP-II
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to stay in a hotel where it's not a corporate clone, but still clean efficient and very friendly. From the website, which gives all the information you need to judge the hotel, through the greeting at the main desk it was a very pleasant experience. I had seen the hotel mentioned in various guides and articles and whilst not the cheapest is what I had budgeted for in the city. The room was a little small but very well maintained and clean, bed very comfortable and had the different touches I had expected. The bathroom was very spacious and well laid out and as for the bath! The note each day about weather and what could be done in Madrid was a nice touch and is worth developing further for guests. At first I thought the neighbourhood a little suspect as it is clearly developing but I very quickly realised it was not a problem area and I felt quite happy returning to the hotel at any time. I am more than happy to recommend a stay for those who want soemthing different for a break.

Reviews.Title: “En suite bathroom???”
Reviews.Author: mumbaiyatri
Reviews.Content: Situated close to the city Centre, this quaint hotel is ideal for a business visit especially when you are travelling by yourself. Unfortunately, we were not used to the idea of having a bathroom in the bed room where the overall impression is of sleeping in the bathroom!! Also, the extremely tiny dining area and the limited food available make this hotel a tad uncomfortable especially since none of the restaurant owners in the nearby places speak any language other than Spanish. So unless you are really familiar with the place or the language, eating out can be a bit of a bother. That apart, the hotel was comfortable. The bed was really great, the hotel clean and the concierge extremely helpful. Perhaps the plus of staying in a small place is the fact that you are forced to go out and enjoy the sites of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Looking Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jeffbrewer21
Reviews.Content: Great location around the corner from Plaza D'Espana, very nice, modern looking rooms, but the rooms are very small for two people and the parking options are absolutely terrible, as are the extrememly narrow streets around the hotel The parking spots that the hotel has in a nearby garage were some of the tightest I have ever seen in the narrowest parking garage I have ever driven in (hence dinging the car up pretty good trying to park) and the other nearby garages are not much better

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful atmosphere and friendly personal service, great beds!”
Reviews.Author: PinnochioCapeTown
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a central location, very comfortable, friendly staff and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Our three days/nights in the Abalu Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenGroves
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel - beds were very comfotable and the staff extremely helpful and friendly. However the basin in our room had the tap too far from the basin so whenever you turned the water on it went everywhere. Also we would have prefered to have more of a separate bathroom - not too keen having it incorparated into the bedroom! Also the room could have been cleaner - there were large foorprints from dirty shoes on the floor which were there when we arrived and were still there when we left! Loved all the decor though and would come and stay again! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “city stop-over”
Reviews.Author: MakerJ
Reviews.Content: we stopped for one night at Abalu and thought it was terrific! Brilliant breakfast, a stylish place with helpful staff. What more can one ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom in the room”
Reviews.Author: Elena208
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff, good location. Only downside: our "bathroom" was a shower & washbasin in the room. So if you're not used to showering & dressing in front of your travel compagnon, that might be a problem. The toilet was seperate. Overall, the rooms are small, the closet not very accessible, but a nice place to stay for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Cupcakefamily
Reviews.Content: Fun, hip and and relaxing. Great Location. The beds are very comfy.............you sleep when you hit the pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced And Poor Quality”
Reviews.Author: JACKIEWGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Abalu after seeing the pictures on the website. Unfortunately the hotel does not live up to the standards shown. We had to be careful to avoid tripping up on the badly worn carpet. The safe in the room wasnt attached to anything and could be simply lifted right out of the room. The remote control for the TV did not work. The door of the mini bar didnt close properly so nothing was chilled. We reported the problems to the reception and despite staying at the hotel for 3 nights they didnt manage to send anyone to fix any of the problems whilst we were there. On returning home I wrote to the manager of the hotel and he replied saying that they called our room but when we answered the phone they decided not to send anyone up when we were in the room!! He also said that we were in a Superior room but as they were aware that the room was due for renovation we were charged on the rate for a standard room - not that it was that much cheaper at €105 plus tax per night it is the price you would pay for a 3 *or 4* hotel in Madrid. The manager argued that we had a "hydro-shower" and therefore that makes it a superior room. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone as you would be disappointed on arrival. It needs to get the rooms tidied up and think about the pricing. We wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: BrazilFlavia
Reviews.Content: Our room was unfinished, dirty and smelling construction glue. We asked to change the room and there was no possibility. We even tried to find another hotel but they were all full. As it was just for one night we stayed... The room was small and very noisy since is not well acustic isolated and the glue smell left me and my husband with a terrible headache. It was a terrible experience. We could never suggest this hotel to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Funky & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retrotripper
Reviews.Content: We were 2 young couples who stayed at the hotel for 6 nights and we found it was very conveniently located, the staff was very friendly and the decor was ideal for a small funky hotel (especially the coffee shop) in the centre of Madrid. Would definitely recommend it to young people, but go for the superior rooms as the standard rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, Shambolic and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: agathajun
Reviews.Content: I'm a sucker for interiors and style in less polished areas (yes, there is a lot of graffiti in the area. There's also some interesting clubs, independent design shops, lower prices, and a sense of being in a place where people live, not just tourists). the decor is fabulous though the rooms are a bit small, and all the edges don't quite meet - a bit unfinished. The lounge is a great place to relax on a hot pink sofa and read Vogue while the sweet staff try to fix the free wireless internet that didn't work at all while I stayed there. The cafe where you can buy breakfast is charming and a nice place for locals. Like most Spanish hotels, it's pretty noisy with thin doors meaning you can hear everything going on in the hall. It was calm and funky, though slightly shambolic, and if you can go with the flow in a frivolous way, will probably have fun.
